codeSystems.title: AllergyIntoleranceCategory
codeSystems.description: Category of an identified substance associated with allergies or intolerances.

codeSystems.name: AllergyIntoleranceCriticality
codeSystems.title: AllergyIntoleranceCriticality
codeSystems.description: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.

codeSystems.name: AllergyIntoleranceType
codeSystems.title: AllergyIntoleranceType
codeSystems.description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for a Reaction Risk.

codeSystems.name: ObservationStatus
codeSystems.title: ObservationStatus
codeSystems.description: Codes providing the status of an observation.

codeSystems.name: QuantityComparator
codeSystems.title: QuantityComparator
codeSystems.description: How the Quantity should be understood and represented.

codeSystems.name: AllergyIntoleranceSeverity
codeSystems.title: AllergyIntoleranceSeverity
codeSystems.description: Clinical assessment of the severity of a reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

codeSystems.name: LOINC
codeSystems.title: Logical Observation Identifiers, Names and Codes (LOINC)
codeSystems.description: LOINC provides a set of universal names and ID codes for identifying laboratory and clinical test results.1,2 LOINC facilitates the exchange and pooling of results, such as blood hemoglobin, serum potassium, or vital signs, for clinical care, outcomes management, and research. LOINC's universal identifiers (names and codes) can be used in the context of order and observation exchanges between information systems that use syntax standards such as HL73, CEN TC251, ISO TC215, ASTM4, and DICOM. Specifically, the identifier can be used as the coded value for an observation in any other standard that uses the observation/observation value paradigm, whether messages, documents, application programming interface (API), etc. For example, LOINC codes are used widely in the OBX segment Observation Identifier field (OBX-3) of an ORU HL7 (HL7 version 2.x or ASTM 1238-9410) message that may be sent between a Clinical Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) and Electronic Health Record Systems (EHR).5, 6 In this way, LOINC codes provide universal identifiers that allow the exchange of clinical data between heterogeneous computing environments.

codeSystems.name: SNOMED_CT
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
codeSystems.description: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).
codeSystems.http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-referenc: Observation Reference Range Applies To Codes

codeSystems.name: AllergyIntoleranceClinicalStatusCodes
codeSystems.title: AllergyIntolerance Clinical Status Codes
codeSystems.description: Preferred value set for AllergyIntolerance Clinical Status.

codeSystems.name: AllergyIntoleranceVerificationStatus
codeSystems.title: AllergyIntolerance Verification Status
codeSystems.description: The verification status to support or decline the clinical status of the allergy or intolerance.

codeSystems.name: DataAbsentReason
codeSystems.title: DataAbsentReason
codeSystems.description: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing.

codeSystems.name: ObservationReferenceRangeMeaningCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Reference Range Meaning Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the meaning/use of a reference range for a particular target population.

codeSystems.name: ObservationInterpretation
codeSystems.title: ObservationInterpretation
codeSystems.description: One or more codes providing a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation, such as "normal" / "abnormal", "low" / "high", "better" / "worse", "resistant" / "susceptible", "expected" / "not expected". The value set is intended to be for ANY use where coded representation of an interpretation is needed.

codeSystems.name: UCUM
codeSystems.title: Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM)
codeSystems.description: The Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM) is a code system intended to include all units of measures being contemporarily used in international science, engineering, and business. The purpose is to facilitate unambiguous electronic communication of quantities together with their units. The focus is on electronic communication, as opposed to communication between humans. A typical application of The Unified Code for Units of Measure are electronic data interchange (EDI) protocols, but there is nothing that prevents it from being used in other types of machine communication.

codeSystems.name: Ietf3066
codeSystems.title: Tags for the Identification of Languages
codeSystems.description: Older value from OID registry.  Superceded; see recommendations in BCP-47.
